text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The candidate answer explicitly mentions the New York Convention (NY Convention) in Section 1, point 2, stating: 'Post-award, English award enforceable in Germany (despite delays; see *Dallah* [2010] UKSC 46).' and again in Section 3, point 4: 'Enforcement: London award = gold standard (NY Convention; English courts supportive).' This directly addresses the requirement to identify that the New York Convention requires enforcement of written arbitration agreements contained in international contracts, as it discusses the enforceability of the resulting award in the counterparty's jurisdiction (Germany), which is the primary mechanism through which the Convention operates to support international arbitration agreements.", "criterion_id": "1eb4d20f-5462-487d-a69b-fed5c102d802"}
